channel.title: Assembly on Josef Spjut
channel.description: Recent content in Assembly on Josef Spjut

item.title: Musical Projects
item.description:
Today I had the fortunate presence of mind to record videos for a couple of my students’ lab projects that I found particularly interesting. In this post I’ll go ahead and embed these videos for anyone interested in watching them. To explain briefly, the assignment was to use assembly programming for the PIC 32 microcontroller to have a speaker produce a song. Optionally, students were allowed to play a song of their choosing after putting that song in the program memory. The following are two of these custom songs chosen by the students.

First up is the video inspiring the tagline, “A Whole New World” which is impressive because these two students created a duet from their projects.

Finally another student recreated a famous internet song.

One last personal note: 10 years ago today I flew home from spending 2 years in Spain.
